Posts.Content: Mar 6, 2011 10:38AM AnaM wrote: Heryky, I had BMX w/TE's on Jan 20th. And yes, to me the worst part was the drains. Thankfully, a friend who had been down this path passed me her 2 vests that she used...they are soft cotton, snap in front, are very roomy AND have inside pockets that hold the drains. THAT WAS THE BEST thing I received during my journey that I am BARELY beginning. I slept with the vests AND I showered with them on because that enabled me to hold on to the grab bar with one hand and soap myself with the other without having to worry about the darned drains. Do you have anything like these vests? I just now saw them in the ACS catalog. Anyway, if you would like to have them you are welcome to them, as my dear friend (member of this group too) wants them passed down. I washed them and wrapped them in soft pink tissue paper and put them in a little white box with a pink ribbon to pass them along to anyone who might need them.

Posts.Content: Mar 10, 2011 03:25AM AnaM wrote: Christine, I am an 11 year ovca survivor. I had a relapse 2 years after first line chemo and was devastated by that. Went on 6 rounds of Carboplatin and I, too, wanted to quit at the 4th round, I just could not find it in me to do 2 more. My husband, family and friends talked me into it, they told me that I had already gone through the worst, why chicken out of the last 2? That I should think I was giving up 2 more months of my life in exchange for YEARS of life. And that just to do THE next one and I could stop there! Somehow, I found the courage to do No. 5...and OF COURSE once I recovered from THAT poison shot, there was just one left so I sucked it up, girl, and finished the stupid thing. I have never regretted it, Christine. I am now at almost 8 years in remission. From Stage 3-B ovarian cancer. Tell yourself it is just ONE more. If you are at all spiritual (I am, very) offere it as a sacrifice so that someone you love so much will NEVER get cancer. Please talk to your Dr. about your wish to stop treatments, they may give you better side-effect meds. Good wishes to you, sister. Ana Maria
